page.title: 04Police in Banbury
page.content: Our Police Station in Banbury is part of Thames Valley Police. It was built in 1974. It is on Warwick Road. They have eight patrol cars, six Panda cars, four C.I.D. vehicles and one personel carrier. There are five male cells and one female. The court days are on Mondays, Thursdays and Fridays. Juveniles Court is held on some Wednesdays. The number of crimes committed since January 1st is 2,077.(Today is July 16th.) We found out that they do not use horses, but they have two police dogs. They have four shifts with eight men on each shift and a sergeant and an inspector. There is one Chief Inspector and a Superintendant. Our community policeman is P.C. Snelling. He sometimes comes into school to give us talks.
